place.name: BASTON
place.gazetteerText: BASTON, a parish in Bourn district, Lincoln; 3½ miles NNW of Market-Deeping, and 3 E by S of Brace borough r. station. It has a post office under Market Deeping. Acres, 3,520. Real property, £5,897. Pop., 787. Houses, 183. The property is much subdivided. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £231. Patron, the Lord Chancellor. The church is tolerable; and there are charities £14. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
